Explanation: The video starts with the Murdoch University shield logo appearing on a white background (1). Then, Eske Willerslev introduces the topic by saying there will be a press release tomorrow about the first original Australian genome (2). Next, Dr Michael Bunce describes isolating DNA from hair shafts (4). Following this, Eske explains that they used a 1920s Southwestern Australian hair sample to avoid recent European admixture (3). Finally, Dr Michael Bunce compares sequencing to a "billion-piece jigsaw" (5), and Dr Joe Dortch adds that archaeological evidence extends the presence to "70,000 years perhaps" (6).
